figure.figDesc:
80.
The postal service in Trinidad and Tobago has shown improvements such as the expansion of
home delivery to rural, isolated, and economically disadvantaged areas, enhanced customer satisfaction,
and improved reliability and security of mail delivery. The percentage of population having mail delivered
at home increased from 53% in 1998 to about 85% in 2003. Very small communities that had no postal
services before are being included in the delivery network.
Source: Ianni and Lohmeyer, 2001; Guislain, 2004; UPU, 2003; and Walsh, 2001.
